body:
## Steps to Reproduce

Here is the code:
```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:volleyballmeetup/src/containers/auth_button/google_auth_button_container.dart';

class AppDrawer extends StatelessWidget {
  final Function onProfileTapCallback;
  final String profilePicUrl;
  final String userName;

  AppDrawer({this.onProfileTapCallback, this.profilePicUrl, this.userName});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) => Drawer(
        child: ListView(children: _getListItems()),
      );

  List<Widget> _getListItems() {
    final list = <Widget>[
      _getHeader(),
      ListTile(
        leading: Icon(Icons.person),
        title: Text('Profile'),
        onTap: onProfileTapCallback,
      ),
    ];
    return list;
  }

  Widget _getHeader() => DrawerHeader(
          child: Container(
        height: 500,
        child: _isLoggedIn()
            ? Row(
                mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
                children: <Widget>[
                  CircleAvatar(
                    maxRadius: 40,
                    backgroundImage: NetworkImage(profilePicUrl),
                  ),
                  Padding(
                    padding: EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 6),
                  ),
                  Text(userName)
                ],
              )
            : GoogleAuthButtonContainer(),
      ));

  bool _isLoggedIn() => profilePicUrl != null && userName != null;
}
```

Android Studio sees the indent as going from right to left when going from a parent to a child, which should not happen (see child height child):

![Image of formatting](https://i.imgur.com/Dcci8Oz.png)


## Version info


comment_data.body:
Thanks for the clear repro steps. I've reopened this issue under dartfmt.
In the meantime, I would avoid using `=>` for build methods as the formatter doesn't handle them well and generally the style guide says to avoid `=>` for very long methods.

rename.to: Code > Reformat Code is incorrect (parent to child indents the wrong way)

title: Code > Reformat Code is incorrect (parent to child indents the wrong way)
